intro: Argostemma albociliatum, commonly known as the white-ciliated argostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a distinctive, serrated edge. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
